Clinical: Ankles, painful; weak. Bone pains. Borborygmus. Constipation. Eructations. Rheumatism.
Characteristics: Mang. mur. was proved by Lembke. The few symptoms obtained were manifested chiefly in the cranial bones, stomach, left shoulder, right knee, and ankles. The stomach pains were < by external pressure.
Head: Vertigo and reeling when walking in open air, < looking down, on descending or stooping (an old symptom revived).
Boring in r. cranial bones; tearing in r, occipital bone.
Stomach: Pressure in stomach < by external pressure.
Stool: Stool harder and scantier than usual.
Upper Limbs: Violent pain in front part of l. shoulder-joint, < by pressure, rolling arm about its axis, and by any motion of arm.
Pain in articulation of l. thumb.
Lower Limbs: Drawing pain with weary feeling in r. thigh while sitting.
Violent drawing pain inner side r. knee.
Pressure in r. knee extending into leg; a bruised sensation remains in ankles; afterwards same pain in l. ankle.
Pressure and drawing in ankle and ankle bones.
